name: Social Security Administration
description: The Social Security Administration delivers social security services that meet the changing needs of the public.

painPoints.point: Legacy mainframe systems modernization critical for processing millions of Social Security benefits and applications
Disability claims processing system improvements to reduce backlog and processing times
Customer service technology modernization for online services and field office operations
Cybersecurity and data protection for sensitive Social Security numbers and personal information
IT infrastructure modernization to replace aging mainframe systems while maintaining service continuity

IT acquisition and management challenges including project delays, budget overruns, and need for improved oversight and mature acquisition practices affecting Social Security benefits processing systems, with over $100 billion annually invested in federal IT
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving IT Acquisitions and Management

strategicPriorities.priority: Mainframe Modernization and IT Infrastructure Replacement

secondary: GAO Reports on SSA IT Modernization and Mainframe Replacement

evaluationFactors: Past performance with large-scale government systems

keyOffices: Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO)
Office of Small and Disadvantaged Business Utilization (OSDBU)
Office of Disability Adjudication and Review
insights: Mainframe modernization is critical priority - one of largest IT modernization efforts in government
Disability claims processing improvements are major focus
Cybersecurity is critical due to sensitivity of Social Security data
Large-scale system integration and migration expertise highly valued
Customer service technology modernization is ongoing priority
